snippet: Public Schools 191 and 199 will not be torn down, but students at the School of Cooperative Technical Education weren’t so lucky.
abstract: New York City Education Department announces that Public Schools 191 and 199 near Lincoln Center in Manhattan, which were being considered as sites for new high-rise apartment buildings, will not be torn down; city will go ahead, however, with development plans for site currently occupied by School of Cooperative Technical Education on East 96th Street.
lead_paragraph: Public Schools 191 and 199 will not be torn down, but students at the School of Cooperative Technical Education weren’t so lucky.

headline.main: Two Public Schools in New York Are Spared the Tear-Down of Development
headline.print_headline: Two Public Schools in City Are Spared the Tear-Down of Development
